website_summaries.verdict: The Q Acoustics 3020i bookshelf speakers combine cutting-edge design with excellent sonics and are suited to systems with tight space requirements.
pros: The affordable Q Acoustics 3020i give smooth, rich sound in a relatively compact design
The speakers are well built, look sweet and are available in a number of attractive finishes
cons: Despite simplified speaker connectors, the 3020is are not suited to wall-mounting
The Elac Debut B6.2 offer better performance for the same money

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely superb
customer_reviews.text: These speakers present the instruments across a natural and spacious soundscape. The instruments that are difficult to reproduce well - the diaphanous saxophone, the wide ranged piano, and the wonder of the voice are all to be heard in their true tonality. This is no small accomplishment. Also remarkable is this speaker's ability to reproduce dense orchestral textures where the listener can easily differentiate the bass and sub-bass instruments such as the contrabassoon and the low clarinets.
customer_reviews.author: bryan  kendall

customer_reviews.title: Great sound from a small, affordable package!
customer_reviews.text: More bass and bigger scale sound than the 3020. Looks great in Walnut finish. Worth every penny! 07/22/18 Update: I've had these speakers for about 3 weeks now and I continue to be amazed by how good they sound. You can really hear into the recording and get a real sense of the acoustic space. They don't add any artificial bloom to the sound yet sound just right tonally. The bass is not overblown yet really kicks when called for. If you want more bass you could add a good subwoofer and you've got a killer system for around $750.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today and I'm very impressed. Sound Quality is Amazing. The mids an highs are glorious. They do excellent with vocals , strings and even piano. Wide detailed soundstage. Some reviews said Low end was lacking but I find the bass satisfying and adequate for a small room . If your a Bass Head and listen to Rock and HipHop alot then you will need a sub. They look good and Sound Great. Very Happy with this Decision. After alot of browsing and reading reviews I'm glad I took a chance on these.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: 💗
customer_reviews.text: These little speakers are powerful and make my small receiver sound like a much more expensive stereo system. I don't even have a subwoofer, and they still deliver big sound as well as clarity to highs, lows, as well as midrange tones. I can’t afford expensive speakers; this pressed my budget as it is, but I can’t imagine being any happier than with these. Lovely design, modern lines and simplicity. Love.
customer_reviews.author: Depop

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are being used as rear speakers for my family room entertainment system. They are a little bigger than I thought they would be. Nonetheless they sound quite good. Really crisp sound with much more punch in the lower range than I would have thought given their size. High end is excellent as well. A very good value for the price with speakers that really punch above their weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way better than price would suggest!
customer_reviews.text: Given the price it's hard to imagine these would sound as good as they do. There are some computer desktop speakers that cost almost as much but these speakers are way better far and above. I have them running off an older amp that sounds ok an older turntable with a mediocre cartridge and have them on shelves a little too close to the wall and despite all that with a recording that's top notch sonically these sounded pretty amazing. I would guess (and may try) to upgrade my cart and my amp and I would bet these will sound ridiculously good.
customer_reviews.author: PV

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I love these compact speakers for their soundstage. The sound seems to envelope you in the listening space, giving a much larger spatial presence than you would expect from such small speakers. I do recommend the subwoofer if you like heavier bass, but these do a decent job on their own. The aesthetics of the speakers would fit right in with mid-century modern decor, from the wood-grain on the veneers to the rounded shape. They are very beautiful for speakers in the price range. I do like the magnetic grilles, but they are a little soft, and I am not sure that they appropriately protect the speaker cones from potential damage from a modest bump.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald P. Smith II

customer_reviews.title: Wow, I am impressed!
customer_reviews.text: These bookshelf speakers have the perfect balance of punchy lows; smooth mids; and crisp highs. I recommend adding the matching subwoofer to fill out the low end, but these are great on their own too. The English Walnut finish has a nice retro-vibe that makes it feel more like furniture. The build quality is excellent. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: LJPIII

customer_reviews.title: Clear, natural-sounding, and easy to listen to
customer_reviews.text: Though small and therefore most suitable for small rooms such as a bedroom or study, these aren't lacking in bass. And you can adjust the bass to your liking with the foam bungs for the ports. They look nice, especially without the grilles, and are just plain enjoyable. Maybe there are better speakers, but you will enjoy these so it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: It might be my receiver, or the bluetooth intermediary I'm using to connect to it, but the speakers don't sound amazing. They sound a bit dull and flat. The highs aren't high enough, and the bass has yet to rumble. I'm generally disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ANOUSKA BISWAS

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW! They are so Amazing
customer_reviews.text: They sound better than anything I’ve demo’d at big box electronics stores jamo, klipsch, entry and midrange B&W, etc., and even Martin Logan electrostatics. I used my vintage 1981 Pioneer A-9 integrated amp to powered them, ran them through a battery of music genres and those little nuances really came to life in the music. I highly recommend those speakers to anyone who wants the perfect loudspeakers under 500/pair.
customer_reviews.author: David Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Speakers sounds great, they have very clear sound. I'm not an audio expert, but these blew my soundbar out of the water. Love how they look. I have it paired with the 3060s sub.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and looks
customer_reviews.text: Yes they sound smooth and detailed. But I like the 3020 bookshelf better than this. The Elac Debut 2 also sound better to me by going a bit deeper, but if you are going for compact bookshelfs, they deserve a consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Renz

customer_reviews.title: speakers are just what i was looking for, couldnt be happier
customer_reviews.text: after months of research decided to try these speakers and couldn't be happier, highly recommend, great volume, sound is amazing with great bass response from small speakers, at this price point a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: paul thornton

customer_reviews.title: But not quite big enough for my room.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely speaker. But I switched them out (and also the amp) because I needed a little more juice. They might have been fine with the stronger amp. Worth checking out.
customer_reviews.author: gmnyc

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bookshelf Speakers
customer_reviews.text: These little guys really surprised me with the amazing sound they produce out of those little boxes. Flat, smooth, and spacious. Add a little more bass extension and some real wood veneer and you really couldn’t ask for more. My Marantz 7000N really makes ‘em sing.
customer_reviews.author: Tony No Baloney

customer_reviews.title: Great sound with an elegant look
customer_reviews.text: Great sound from small speakers! Walnut finish adds a nice touch of class.
customer_reviews.author: CarrieO

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best
customer_reviews.text: The difference in terms of sound quality between these guys and more high end speakers is minimal. Plus, these are easily the coolest looking bookshelf speakers on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous speakers, great sound
customer_reviews.text: I love these speakers! I am using them with a Sonos Amp and Fluance RT82 turntable. Excellent highs and mid's but you will need a sub and you will need to play with the crossover frequency to hit that sweet spot!
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, compact bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: These present a very nice package. Clean design, lovely full sound with more bass than you would expect from speakers this compact. I am very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: new speakers
customer_reviews.text: After 40 some odd years, we replaced our old, huge wood speakers with these. We really wanted the richness of tone of our old ones but much smaller. These really fit the bill. Great separation and wonderful tone. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: elaine Grant

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent speakers
customer_reviews.text: They look and sound great. I have them wired to the Sonos Amp.
customer_reviews.author: jetjim

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure if they hype would be true for these speakers but I’ve been consistently pleased. They sound “right” to my ears. They’re currently handling a mix of music inputs between vinyl and streaming and sound great in each use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Conklin

customer_reviews.title: cant say enough
customer_reviews.text: Nothing can touch these for this price for sound quality and to be this small and do that is crazy
customer_reviews.author: brian walcher

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built speakers... Great sound and value!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built speakers... Great sound and value! Will be purchasing additional speakers in the model lineup.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Perez

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional audiophile quality!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound and complexity! I am using these in the back half of a VERY large cinema room and they are killers! I paired them with a large pair of vintage Wharfedale W70 and it's a great pairing.
customer_reviews.author: TheBigWoo

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these along with the qacoustics center channel. By far the best improvement for my setup
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers at a great price. I was thrilled at clarity.
customer_reviews.author: brian pope

customer_reviews.title: QA 3020i While they all are good speakers, the QA stood out with its clarity/detail
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from QA website Had last years 3020 for my son. Upgraded this for my son's room. As another reviewer noted, much improved over last year. I auditioned Elac B6 2.0, Emotiva B1, QA 3020i While they all are good speakers, the QA stood out with its clarity/detail. In addition, this has to be one of the most beautiful speakers you can buy under $500...heck maybe even under $1000 Sometimes I just like looking at it. Low end isn't best, not bad, Elac has a little more, but I've learned this you can add bass artificially by subwoofers However, you can't add clarity/detail artificially so these were an easy choice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Q Acoustics Builds A Small Bookshelf Speaker That No Klipsch Can Compare With
customer_reviews.text: You'll need at least 50w no less than 30w of power to fully appreciate these speakers. A very reliable HiFI source has reviewed these speakers the Q Acoustics 3020, What HIfI . These speakers react very well with better electronics including speaker wire and interconnects in your system. The better you feed these speakers with equipment the better they will react and sound.
customer_reviews.author: MMH

customer_reviews.title: Nothing under $1000 to beat this - I own quite a few high end speakers
customer_reviews.text: For folks eyeing this. Current it’s on sale with 2 pairs of XT25 fully finished speaker cables thrown in free ( QAs own high audiophile quality ones) along with the pair of 3020i speakers on QA site. It’s a no brainer buy... go for it. The center also comes with a pair of free speaker cables
customer_reviews.author: Dealzguy

customer_reviews.title: Great for my office!
customer_reviews.text: I am using these with a PS Audio Sprout, and replaced some Micca speakers. Wow, what a difference. These sound detailed, full and involving. Listening to high res music really shows what these beautiful speakers can do.
customer_reviews.author: Wildgift

product_meta.title: Q Acoustics 3020i Bookshelf Speaker Pair (Carbon Black)
feature_bullets: Award-winning design heritage to shelf or stand mount to fit seamlessly into your chosen listening room, Larger cabinet increased cabinet volume from previous models delivering a larger scale sound and deeper bass

P2PTM bracing - helps keep the enclosure extra quiet through computer aided placement of internal bracing, Uses a 22mm decoupled High Frequency Driver with wide surround creating a wide even dispersion of stereo
New low profile binding posts have been incorporated with sockets deep enough to accept 4mm (0.16 in) Banana Plugs

Enclosure Type: 2-way reflex, Bass Driver: 125 mm (5 in), Tweeter: 22 mm (0.9 in), Frequency Response: 64Hz - 30kHz, Impedance: 6Ohms, Minimum Impedance: 4Ohms, Sensitivity: (2.83 V@1 m) 88dB, Power Input: 50-125W, Cross-over Frequency: 2.4kHz, Dimensions (WxHxD): 170x278x282 mm, Weight: 5.5kg
What's in the box: 2 x 3020i bookshelf speakers, 2 x Speaker Grilles, 2 x Foam Bungs, 1 x User Manual, 1 x Handling Gloves.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars223 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
